title: Body background color default not working
content:
After tinkering with about:config (shouldn't have...) the background of every page that does not specify a body background color turns the color of my theme background color.

Using the firefox color pipette says its white, but it clearly isn't.

The theme i have is dark, making any page that expects the background to be white unreadable (without DevTools -> Body -> background-color: white)

I haven't been able to find the config that fixes it.

title: Change to tab display in 142.0.1, how to disable new behavior?
content:
Recently an update made it to where closing a tab group no longer works. It closes MOST of the tab group, leaving the last used one active along with a number to the right such as "+3" to show there are three more tabs hidden. This completely defeats the purpose of being able to close the tab group in the first place. In order to get around this, you have to click another tab to make it active and only then will the tab group you tried to close, actually close. Is there a way to disable this behavior so that closing tab groups actually works?

Assuming there is no fix, how can I downgrade to a previous version without losing all my settings, bookmarks, etc? Can I just uninstall the broken version and install the older version?

Thanks!
creator: fleasales.help

title: Mozilla Firefox's Open Dialog vs Windowblinds skin
content:
I am using Windowblids 11 to skin my Windows 11 and even when Mozilla Firefox (firefox.exe) is excluded from skinning, Open Dialog (in case of the picture it is Save As Dialog) has incorrect context menu, unusable basically. I reported this issue on Stardock support and I was told that Firefox is blocking crucial dll which Windowblids is using for skinning. This is what they told me:

"Unfortunately this is being caused by Firefox itself.

It is preventing a critical WindowBlinds dll from loading into the process that owns the file open dialog and in doing so is breaking Windows theming support for that which is why the menu shows incorrectly.

They would need to stop blocking wbload.dll in child processes. If they had issues with that then they should have contacted us so we could investigate a solution."

It would be great if there could be some fix for this. They receive a lot of Firefox incompatibility issues so I think they would love to fix this. In general as a user of both I hope for better compatibility between Windowblinds and other software such as Firefox.

Thank you for your time and efforts.

Versions I am using: - Windows 11 Home 24H2 - WindowBlinds 11.06 - Mozilla Firefox 142.0.1 (64 bit)
creator: larahcroft

title: Why isn’t my website for a Nasha Mukti Kendra in Punjab showing up properly in Firefox?
content:
There could be a few reasons why your website isn’t displaying correctly in Firefox. Sometimes it's due to outdated browser versions, cached data, or missing SSL certificates. Make sure your site is mobile-friendly, uses HTTPS, and passes basic performance checks on tools like PageSpeed Insights or GTmetrix.

I had a similar issue with a website for a Nasha Mukti Kendra in Punjab — it looked fine in Chrome but had layout issues in Firefox. Clearing the cache and fixing some CSS compatibility problems solved it. You might also want to check for any browser-specific code or unsupported scripts.

title: Lost All Firefox Data After Laptop Reboot
content: Hi, I’ve lost all of my saved passwords, bookmarks, and browsing history in Firefox. I’ve been a Firefox user for over five years, always tied to the same Firefox account email. My laptop recently had to be repaired, and the technicians performed a full reboot. After getting it back and reinstalling Firefox, all my data was gone. I tried recovering an old profile, but the reboot erased everything, so there are no old profiles or local data left on the device. Since my Firefox account has always been connected to the same email, I was hoping all of my data would still be recoverable, but I haven’t had any success. This represents over five years of saved information, and I really need help to restore it. Can Firefox support assist me in recovering my data through my account? Thanks in advance.
